sen.j: 明一（みょういつ、神亀5年（728年）- 延暦17年3月27日 (旧暦)（798年4月21日））は、奈良時代から平安時代前期にかけての僧。
sen.e: Myoitsu (728 - April 21, 798) was a Buddhist monk from the Nara period to the early Heian period.
Myoitsu (728 - April 21, 798) was a Buddhist monk from the Nara period to the early Heian period.
Myoitsu (728 - April 21, 798) was a Buddhist monk from the Nara period to the early Heian period.
His secular surname was the Oya clan.
His secular surname was Oya.
sen.cmt: この場合の｢大宅氏」はclan不要ではないかと思われます。
sen.e: His secular surname was Oya.

sen.j: 大和国添上郡大宅郷の出身。
sen.e: He came from Oyakori, Soekamigun (also known as Sofunokaminokoori), Yamato Prefecture.
He came from Oyakori, Soekami-gun (also known as Sofunokaminokoori), Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: 「大和国添上郡」の表記を指示にそって直しました。また、カッコ内は原文にありません（一応、残してあります）。
sen.e: He came from Oyakori Village, Soekami County, Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: Soekami-gun→Soekami County(also known as Sofunokaminokoori)を削除しました。

sen.j: 東大寺の慈訓に師事して修学。
sen.e: He studied under Jikun (also known as Jikin) in Todaij Temple.
He studied under Jikun (also known as Jikin) in Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「東大寺」の表記を直しました。
sen.e: He studied under Jikun (also known as Jikin) in Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 753年（天平勝宝4年）東大寺盂蘭盆経の講師を、また780年（宝亀11年）には維摩会の講師をつとめた。
sen.e: In 753, he served as an instructor in a sutra Urabonkyo at Todaij Temple, and in 780, he served as an instructor of the Yuimae, a religious service.
In 753, he served as an instructor in a sutra Urabonkyo at Todai-ji Temple, and in 780, he served as an instructor of the Yuimae, a religious service.
sen.cmt: 「東大寺」の表記を直しました。
sen.e: In 753, he served as an instructor in a sutra Urabonkyo at Todai-ji Temple, and in 780, he served as an instructor of the Yuimae, a religious service.

sen.j: 延暦初年に行賀が唐から帰国した際に、宗議を問い質し行賀の学を痛罵した。
sen.e: When Gyoga returned from Tang in 782, he queried Gyoga the doctrine of the sect and criticized Gyoga's study.
When Gyoga returned from Tang in 782, he queried Gyoga the doctrine of the sect and criticized Gyoga's study.
When Gyoga returned from Tang in 782, he questioned Gyoga about the sect's doctrine and criticized his studies severely.

sen.j: しかしこれは、行賀が30年余り唐にいたことから日本語を忘れてしまったからだといわれている。
sen.e: But it is said that he criticized Gyoga because Gyoga forgot the Japanese over 30 years in Tang.
But it is said that he criticized Gyoga because Gyoga forgot the Japanese over 30 years in Tang.
The reason for this is said to be that, having stayed in Tang for over 30 years, Gyoga was unable to make himself understood in Japanese.

sen.j: この頃三綱のうちの上座として東大寺の運営にあたり、794年（延暦13年）には比叡山根本中堂供養の職衆をつとめている。
sen.e: Around this period, Myoitsu operated Todaiji Temple as a high-ranked monk called Joza among the administrative positions called Sango, and in 794, he served as one of monks called Shokushu to take part in the memorial service of the main building Konponchudo in Mount Hiei.

sen.j: 晩年には妻帯したことから名声を失ったといわれている。
sen.e: In his late years, he married and because of that, he lost his reputation.
It has been said that in his late years, he married and because of that, he lost his reputation.
